author: Sudiksha Kochi
description: The House Ethics Committee announced Wednesday that it will create a new subcommittee tasked with investigating a wide swath of allegations against Rep. Cory Mills (R-Fla.). That includes whether he violated campaign finance laws, received special favors in his position, engaged in sexual misconduct, and misused congressional resources, according to a press release. The committee has…
title: Ethics Committee opens investigation into Mills ahead of censure vote

author: Ella Lee
description: A federal judge is planning to revive contempt proceedings against Trump administration officials who disobeyed his order to turn around deportation flights destined for El Salvador.  The proceedings were put on hold for months as the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit mulled the matter. But U.S. District Judge James Boasberg said…
title: Judge Boasberg to revive contempt proceedings over Alien Enemies Act deportations

author: Max Rego
description: The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) is facing big changes even after normal funding has resumed with the end of the government shutdown, Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins said Wednesday. “Clearly there’s a right-sizing that needs to happen [with the program],” Rollins told host Nichole Berlie on NewsNation Now. Since the 43-day shutdown ended last week,…
title: Rollins: SNAP facing ‘right-sizing’ and ‘structural changes’ after shutdown

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: The federal judge who dissented from the order striking down Texas’s new Republican-friendly House map torched his colleague in an explosive opinion published Wednesday, accusing him of “pernicious judicial misbehavior.”  “In my 37 years on the federal bench, this is the most outrageous conduct by a judge that I have ever encountered in a case in which I have been involved,” wrote U.S. Circuit Judge Jerry Smith.  His 104-page…
title: Dissenting judge torches colleague for ‘judicial misbehavior’ in blocking Texas map

author: Julia Shapero
description: Nvidia reported strong third-quarter earnings Wednesday, easily surpassing Wall Street’s expectations for the chipmaker at the center of the AI race.  The company posted $57 billion in revenue in the three-month period from July to September, up 62 percent from the same time last year. Analysts expected the firm to report a revenue of $54.92…
title: Nvidia beats expectations with strong third quarter earnings

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Cook Political Report shifted several races in Virginia and New Jersey toward Democrats on Wednesday after the party scored wins earlier this month, indicating the tides may be changing within the MAGA base ahead of midterm elections. In the Old Dominion State, House races in the 1st, 2nd, and 10th districts were adjusted to favor…
title: Cook Political Report shifts New Jersey, Virginia House seats toward Democrats

author: Filip Timotija
description: Saudi Arabia is releasing a U.S. citizen who was jailed over social media posts critical of the royal family, returning home after President Trump’s bilateral meeting with Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman in Washington, D.C. Saad Almadi, 75, who immigrated to the U.S. in 1976, was arrested in 2021 during a family visit over his…
title: Saudi Arabia releases jailed US citizen after Trump, Crown Prince Mohammed meeting

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) on Wednesday poured cold water on an effort by Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) to repeal a provision buried in the government funding bill that Congress passed last week that would allow senators to sue the Justice Department for surveilling their activities. Thune argued that the provision to give Republican…
title: Thune fires back at House GOP effort to repeal senators’ $500,000 damages provision

author: Ryan Mancini
description: The Department of Justice (DOJ) announced Wednesday a $15 million reward for information on former Olympic snowboarder Ryan Wedding, who faces new charges in connection with a drug-trafficking operation. Wedding, 44, a Canadian citizen living in Mexico, faces nine charges that include two additional counts of witness tampering and intimidation, murder, money laundering, and drug…
title: Former Olympic snowboarder Ryan Wedding facing new charges; reward in case rises

author: Meg Hilling
description: "We know that parents just want to keep their kids safe, but part of the confusion comes from how fast information changes," Adams said.
title: Former surgeon general warns of vaccine ‘misinformation’

author: Tara Suter
description: Former Secretary of State and presidential candidate Hillary Clinton said that “abortion bans have killed another woman in Texas” in response to a ProPublica report published Wednesday. Clinton’s comments came in a Wednesday post on the social platform X, which included a link to ProPublica’s story. According to the outlet, a 37-year-old woman named Tierra…
title: Hillary Clinton: ‘Abortion bans have killed another woman in Texas’

author: Sylvan Lane
description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) will not release a federal employment report for October after missing the window to collect data from households during the government shutdown, the agency announced Wednesday. In a press release, the BLS said it was unable to conduct its monthly survey of households — which makes up half of…
title: Labor Department scraps October jobs report due to shutdown

author: Zach Kaplan
description: Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre said Prince Andrew felt “entitled” to her and said she was given $15,000 for her first night with him.
title: Former Prince Andrew removed from plaques in Falkland Islands

author: Joseph Choi
description: The House Ways and Means Committee is demanding an answer from a New Jersey organ donation group accused of engaging in illegal practices, including harvesting organs from a person who was showing signs of life. In a letter to the New Jersey Organ and Tissue Sharing Network (NJTO), Ways and Means Chair Jason Smith (R-Mo.)…
title: New Jersey group attempted to harvest organs from patient with signs of life, House panel alleges

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Stacey Plaskett is a former Republican who now serves as the Democratic delegate for the U.S. Virgin Islands. Her name has been entangled in the saga involving the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein after new documents unveiled that she consulted with Epstein during a 2019 hearing with former Trump fixer Michael Cohen. On Tuesday, Rep.…
title: Who is Stacey Plaskett, Democrat who texted Epstein during hearing?

author: Dan Simpson, opinion contributor
description: The American restaurant industry is facing a crisis as workers with valid work permits are being stripped of their legal protections, threatening businesses and the economy, and the Essential Workers for Economic Advancement Act offers a potential solution.
title: Balanced immigration solutions can help protect America’s restaurants

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Calley Means, a top adviser to Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., has formally joined the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS). A staff directory for the department lists Means as a senior adviser in the Office of the Secretary.   An HHS spokesperson confirmed to The Hill that the wellness entrepreneur is joining the department as…
title: RFK Jr. ally Calley Means formally joins Trump administration

author: Peter C. Earle, opinion contributor
description: The 50-year mortgage is being proposed as a way to make homeownership more affordable, but it risks distorting prices, increasing fragility, and shifting risk onto taxpayers while not addressing the underlying causes of housing unaffordability.
title: 50-year mortgages won’t fix our housing supply problems

author: Lindsey Granger, opinion contributor
description: One thing you learn fast when you cover global stories and spend time on the ground in different countries: hosting a World Cup is transformative.   I was just in Qatar last week and you could see how that tournament has reshaped their entire tourism economy. Infrastructure upgrades, packed hotels, new jobs, a level of…
title: Trump sends warning shot to Dem cities ahead of World Cup

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: Frankly, it’s astonishing that this is actually happening.
title: Trump keeping his promise to abolish Education Department

author: Tara Suter
description: Far-right activist Laura Loomer on Tuesday said the Republican Party “has a Nazi problem” in the wake of ideological infighting among the right. “I’m going to say it. The GOP has a Nazi problem. And the more we pretend like we don’t, the worse it’s going to get. We do. Don’t tell me we don’t,”…
title: Laura Loomer says GOP has a ‘Nazi problem’

author: Max Rego
description: Press groups slammed President Trump for saying Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman “knew nothing” about the 2018 murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi. During an Oval Office meeting with the de facto Saudi leader on Tuesday, the president interjected when ABC News’s Mary Bruce asked the crown prince about his alleged role in the incident,…
title: Trump faces blowback from journalists over Khashoggi remarks

author: Ella Lee
description: The Justice Department on Wednesday admitted that the operative indictment against former FBI Director James Comey was never presented to the full grand jury — a procedural error defense attorneys say should bar the prosecution.   The admission came under sharp questioning from U.S. District Judge Michael Nachmanoff, after several judges overseeing parts of the…
title: DOJ admits full grand jury never reviewed final Comey indictment, further imperiling case

author: Sierra Rains
description: A new court filing has revealed more about the death of an 18-year-old Florida girl aboard a Carnival cruise ship, and the ongoing investigation into the matter.
title: Stepsibling linked to investigation in death of Florida teen aboard Carnival cruise: Reports

author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump’s deal to allow the sale of F-35 advanced fighter jets to Saudi Arabia has the potential to alter the military balance of power in the Middle East. The package of fifth-generation stealth fighters has prompted concerns among Israeli and some U.S. officials as it risks toppling Israel’s so-called qualitative military edge (QME), a…
title: How Trump’s Saudi F-35 deal could alter Mideast balance of power

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: New York City Police Commissioner Jessica Tisch confirmed Wednesday she will remain in her post under Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani, ensuring continuity as she leads the city’s effort to reduce crime. Mamdani, the democratic socialist who previously called to defund the city’s police force, had asked Tisch to stay on as commissioner, but it was unclear…
title: NYPD Commissioner Jessica Tisch confirms she will lead police under Mamdani

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Former Fox News anchor Gretchen Carlson attacked President Trump for a pair of incidents during which he snapped at female reporters who asked about his ties to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. “Trump is despicable towards female reporters,” Carlson wrote Tuesday in a post on social platform X, “just now ridiculing the [ABC] reporter calling…
title: Gretchen Carlson: Trump treatment of female reporters ‘despicable’

author: Julia Shapero
description: Tech mogul Elon Musk suggested Wednesday that work will become “optional” in the future as AI continues to develop.  The billionaire offered the bold prediction when asked at the U.S.-Saudi Investment Forum about fears surrounding the future of jobs. “It’ll be like playing sports or a video game or something like that,” he said. “In the…
title: Elon Musk suggests AI will make work ‘optional’ and money irrelevant

author: David McCall, opinion contributor
description: The United Steelworkers (USW) are calling for the U.S. International Development Finance Corp. (DFC) to include domestic content provisions, labor and environmental standards in its projects to ensure that American workers and communities benefit from the investments.
title: ‘America First’ means giving US workers a stake in overseas development

author: Julia Manchester
description: The White House has nominated Stuart Levenbach, a senior official at the Office of Management and Budget (OMB), to be the director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB).  An official told The Hill the nomination is a “technical” move designed to extend OMB Director Russell Vought’s tenure as the agency’s acting director, and that…
title: Trump nominates OMB official to lead CFPB amid attacks on watchdog agency

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: A significant majority of American voters say they would rather elect a Democrat than a Republican to represent them in Congress in next year’s midterms, according to the latest Marist Poll. The survey, conducted last week, shows Democrats with a 14 percentage point advantage over Republicans, 55 percent to 41 percent, when respondents were asked…
title: Democrats hold 14-point lead over GOP on generic ballot: Poll

author: The Hill Staff
description: President Trump will give remarks Wednesday afternoon at a U.S.-Saudi business forum centered on investment. The event comes a day after Trump welcomed Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to the White House. During the meeting, the president designated Saudi Arabia as a major non-NATO ally, signaled the nation’s investment in the U.S. could reach $1…
title: Watch live: Trump gives remarks at US-Saudi Investment Forum

author: Gordon G. Chang, opinion contributor
description: Trump’s message at the end of last month is that the U.S. is no longer willing to ignore obvious dangers, especially if China poses them.
title: Trump has good reasons to want nuclear weapons tests

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Billionaire Tom Steyer joined the California governor’s race Wednesday, four years after stating he had “no plans” to run for public office again.  Steyer said he’s running to lead the Golden State because “Californians deserve a life they can afford.” “Sacramento politicians are afraid to change this system. I’m not,” he added in a caption…
title: Tom Steyer joins California governor race

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: The Washington Post’s editorial board blasted President Trump for comments dismissing the death of journalist Jamal Khashoggi during a Tuesday meeting with Saudi Arabia Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman. Trump, when asked about Khashoggi’s death, said “a lot of people didn’t like that gentleman that you’re talking about … Whether you like him or didn’t like…

author: Devon Kurtz, opinion contributor
description: State and local leaders are beginning to forge a new path forward that takes seriously the humanitarian crisis consuming the streets of America’s cities.
title: Finally, the failed era of Housing First is over

author: Max Rego
description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is sending roughly 250 federal immigration officers to New Orleans, The Associated Press reported Tuesday. The operation, dubbed “Swamp Sweep,” intends to arrest roughly 5,000 individuals across southeast Louisiana and Mississippi. It will begin on Dec. 1, according to the AP. When reached for comment, DHS assistant secretary Tricia…
title: DHS planning to send hundreds of agents to Louisiana: Report

author: Rachel Frazin
description: A federal appeals court on Tuesday halted a California law requiring companies to disclose the risks that climate change poses to their business. The Ninth Circuit issued a motion holding up the enforcement of California’s Senate Bill 261 while the case against it plays out.  That law would have required companies to prepare a report on their climate-related financial…
title: Appeals court pauses California law requiring companies to disclose climate risks

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: House Judiciary Committee Chair Jim Jordan (R-Ohio) made a criminal referral for a top prosecutor on the team of special counsel Jack Smith, arguing that by refusing to answer some questions, Thomas Windom had engaged in an “intentional, corrupt effort to thwart the Committee’s inquiry.” Windom, who was fired by the Justice Department (DOJ) shortly…
title: Jordan refers former Jack Smith attorney for prosecution

author: Sheldon H. Jacobson, opinion contributor
description: If Congress is smart, they will find the $31 billion needed to upgrade air traffic control technologies and give air traffic controllers state-of-the art tools to do their job.
title: The shutdown is over, but that won’t fix issues with air travel for Thanksgiving

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Harvard announced Tuesday it is investigating Larry Summers, a faculty member and former president of the university, and other school affiliates over ties to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.    The new review comes after a mountain of new documents were released by the House last Wednesday that detailed a close friendship between Summers and…

description: Jena-Lisa Jones, a survivor of the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein’s abuse, said Tuesday that President Trump owes the victims an apology for prolonging attempts to release files related to Epstein’s sex trafficking allegations. “He owes us an apology for sure. And I think that would be one way of showing some remorse for…

author: Michael Starr Hopkins, opinion contributor
description: Polite politics will not save democracy.
title: To voters, Democrats aren’t calm — they’re comatose

author: The Hill Staff
description: The House Administration Committee is convening Wednesday to consider a ban on stock trading by lawmakers and their close family members. A bipartisan group of lawmakers unveiled the Restore Trust in Congress Act in September, which combines several past proposals that would put new restrictions in place around stock trading. The move comes after years of unsuccessful attempts.…
title: Watch live: House panel considers congressional stock trading ban

author: Rob Taub
description: The word "parasocial"  was inspired by Swift's lyrics and her engagement to Travis Kelce this summer.
title: Taylor Swift inspires Cambridge Dictionary’s ‘Word of the Year’

description: After months of wrangling over the files of Jeffrey Epstein, the legislation that forces their release by the Justice Department could become law Wednesday. The House and Senate overwhelmingly passed the bill Tuesday, and it awaits President Trump’s signature. But what happens next is unclear. With Attorney General Pam Bondi ordered to investigate the ties…

description: Rep. Clay Higgins (R-La.) on Tuesday was the only House member to vote against a bill that will order the Justice Department to release files related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Higgins, a conservative lawmaker with a background in law enforcement, said he’s been a “principled ‘NO’” on the Epstein Files Transparency…

description: Naturally, these state departments of education deny that they are reducing rigor, but the data show otherwise.
title: Lowering the bar on proficiency is the latest fad in public education

description: Economist and former Treasury Secretary Larry Summers resigned from his role on the OpenAI board days after leaked emails unveiled his ties to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. “Larry has decided to resign from the OpenAI Board of Directors, and we respect his decision,” the board said in a statement to The Hill. “We…
title: Larry Summers steps down from OpenAI amid Epstein fallout

author: Sean Tinney, opinion contributor
description: Canada's privatized system is safer, cheaper, and doesn't have to be shut down every time Congress fails to pass appropriations bills.
title: Shutdown lesson: We should privatize air traffic control, just like Canada did

description: Today: Congress sends Epstein files bill to Trump, James Comey's day in court, Texas map blocked, immigration enforcement operations expanding

During a press conference outside the U.S. Capitol earlier in the day, Greene spoke with Reps. Ro Khanna (D-Calif.) and Thomas Massie (R-Ky.), the sponsors of a bill that…
title: Greene questions whether DOJ will release the full Epstein documents

author: Emily Brooks
description: The House on Tuesday evening rejected a House Freedom Caucus-pushed resolution to formally censure Democratic Virgin Islands Del. Stacey Plaskett and to remove her from the House Intelligence Committee over recently-released documents that show she consulted with Jeffrey Epstein during a 2019 hearing. The vote was 209-214-3. Three Republicans voted “no” with all Democrats, and…
title: House rejects resolution to censure House Democrat over texting Epstein during hearing

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Former national security adviser John Bolton on Tuesday defended President Trump’s remarks about Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman over the death of Washington Post columnist Jamal Khashoggi and Saudi Arabia’s alleged involvement in the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks. Bolton, who was federally indicted last month, told host Blake Burman on “The Hill on NewsNation”…

The letter to Rhea states that the committee “is reviewing the possible mismanagement of the federal government’s investigation of Mr. Jeffrey Epstein and Ms.…
